entry.title: Category Management in Procurement: A Comprehensive Guide (Part 1 of 3)
entry.content:
Definition

Category management in procurement is a strategic approach that organizes procurement resources to focus on specific areas of spend. This method divides products and services into categories which are managed as a whole, rather than individually. 

By grouping similar items, organizations can streamline processes and develop targeted strategies for each category. It fosters a deeper understanding of procurement needs, supplier relationships, and market trends, resulting in a more efficient and effective procurement process.  

 

Why Is It Important?

Transitioning from the definition, it is essential to understand the unique advantages that category management offers.

Cost Savings

Category management enables organizations to leverage their buying power by consolidating purchases within specific categories. This strategic approach helps in negotiating better prices and terms with suppliers, leading to significant cost savings. 

Companies can identify and eliminate inefficiencies, reduce waste, and achieve more favorable pricing structures. 

For example, according to a Deloitte Global CPO Survey, organizations implementing category management have reported cost reductions of up to 15% (Deloitte, 2023).

Improved Supplier Relationships

Focusing on specific categories allows procurement professionals to develop closer and more collaborative relationships with key suppliers. This fosters trust and cooperation, leading to improved quality, reliability, and innovation. Strong supplier relationships also provide the opportunity for joint problem-solving and long-term partnerships, enhancing overall supply chain performance.

As a real-time example, consider the automotive industry. According to a study conducted by McKinsey & Company, companies that implemented category management strategies reported a 12% improvement in supplier reliability and an 8% increase in innovation through collaborative efforts (McKinsey, 2022). These numbers highlight the significant impact that focusing on specific categories can have on supplier relationships and overall industry performance.

Enhanced Market Insights

Category management involves thorough market analysis and understanding of industry trends, which helps organizations stay ahead of the curve. By continuously monitoring the market, companies can identify emerging opportunities, mitigate risks, and adapt to changes more effectively.

This proactive approach enables better decision-making and strategic planning. Market intelligence gathered through category management supports organizations in responding swiftly to market shifts.

As a real-time example, consider the retail industry. According to a study conducted by KPMG in 2021, companies that implemented category management reported a 10% increase in market responsiveness and a 7% reduction in risks associated with supplier partnerships. These figures highlight the substantial impact of market insights gained through category management on overall business performance.

Additional Reasons

Risk Management: By having a comprehensive view of each category, organizations can better assess and manage risks associated with suppliers and market fluctuations.

Efficiency: Streamlining procurement processes within categories leads to more efficient operations, reducing time and resources spent on managing individual transactions.

Compliance: Ensuring that all procurement activities within categories adhere to regulatory requirements and company policies.

Innovation: Encouraging suppliers to bring innovative solutions and ideas by fostering strategic partnerships.

Sustainability: Promoting sustainable practices and sourcing by focusing on specific categories and collaborating with suppliers who adhere to environmental standards.

 

Who Is the Target Group?

Understanding the target audience for category management within a procurement organization is crucial for ensuring successful implementation and achieving the desired benefits. 

Both primary and secondary audiences play significant roles in driving the initiative forward. Recognizing these audiences helps tailor communication and training e@orts, which is essential for organizational alignment.

Primary Audience

Chief Procurement O0icers (CPOs): Responsible for overall procurement strategy and performance, CPOs benefit from category management by gaining a streamlined approach to procurement, enabling better decision-making, and achieving significant cost savings.

Category Managers: They directly manage specific categories of spend. Category management empowers them with deeper market insights, better supplier relationships, and improved negotiation power, allowing them to deliver enhanced value to the organization. By equipping category managers with robust analytical tools and frameworks, organizations enable more strategic sourcing and supplier management.

Procurement Analysts: These professionals analyze data and trends to support procurement decisions. With category management, they can focus their analyses on specific spend areas, leading to more accurate and actionable insights. This specialization enhances their ability to identify cost-saving opportunities and drive process improvements.

Secondary Audience

Finance Teams: They benefit from the cost savings and budget predictability that category management offers, assisting in more accurate financial planning and reporting.

Operations Managers: Operations benefit from improved procurement processes and supplier reliability, leading to smoother operations and reduced disruptions in the supply chain. 

IT Departments: As procurement increasingly leverages technology, IT departments support the infrastructure and tools needed for effective category management. They benefit from clearly defined procurement categories that align with organizational goals. Their involvement ensures that digital solutions are tailored to procurement’s evolving needs.

In summary, category management in procurement is a strategic initiative that benefits various stakeholders within an organization. By understanding the needs and roles of both primary and secondary audiences, procurement professionals can ensure successful implementation and maximize the advantages of this approach. This interconnectedness is crucial for building a resilient and agile procurement function.

entry.title: Configure Single-Sign-On for SAP Ariba with SAP Cloud Identity Services
entry.content:
See as well:
  • Summary: SAP Ariba, SAP Business Network, SAP Fieldglass SSO with SAP IAS
  • Overview: SAP Ariba SSO with SAP Cloud Identity Services - Identity Authentication

Abstract

With the introduction in 2505 release of the feature 'Configure Authentication with SAP Cloud Identity Services for SAP Ariba Solutions in Intelligent Configuration Manager (CFG-324)' , Single-Sign-On (SSO) configuration for SAP Ariba with SAP Cloud Identity Services (CIS) is simplified and further automated, as detailed in this blog post.

Prerequisites

  • SAP Ariba user of type Third Party Enterprise User (Ariba)
  • Customer Administrator group membership
  • S-User ID in SAP for Me

Note: It is strongly recommended to use https as the SAP Ariba SSO SAML 2.0 Issuer, for security reason and for alignment with the auto-generated configuration described below. A support ticket requesting  PS-1444 Feature Toggle is required to enable the use of https in the issuer.

Process

1. Access SAP Ariba Intelligent Configuration Manager (ICM)

Access the SAP Ariba tenant using the Third Party Enterprise User (Ariba) created as part of the prerequisites.

  • Build the login URL appending '?passwordadapter=ThirdPartyUser' to use Third Party User authentication. For example for US Datacenter: https://<SAP Ariba tenant id>.procurement.ariba.com?passwordadapter=ThirdPartyUser
  • Open ICM - Navigate to Manage > Core Administration (for SAP Ariba procurement tenant) / Administration (for SAP Ariba sourcing tenants) > Intelligent Configuration Manager > Manage Configurations > Click Continue button
  • Open the Authentication tab of ICM

 

Note: In case of configuring the SSO setup for SAP Ariba Sourcing, SAP Ariba Contracts, SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance for suite-integrated tenants the SSO setup needs to be executed on the SAP Ariba procurement tenant.

In case of  SAP Ariba Multi-ERP configuration setup (f.k.a Federated Process Control FPC) the SSO configuration needs to happen for the parent tenant. 

2. S-User ID configuration

The S-User ID must be linked to the same organization as the SAP Ariba tenant (and CIS tenant to use if already provisioned), this can be verified by opening the System & Provisioning section of the SAP4Me portal, connected with the S-User and validating that the SAP Ariba tenant (and CIS Tenant if already provisioned) appear as in the below example with SAP Ariba Procurement and provisioned CIS Tenant.

 

 

  • Enter the S-User ID and click Validate - The validation process takes around a minute and requires page refresh to update the status

 

  • Once validated, use the Enable button to enable the site for CIS configuration

 

3. CIS Tenant selection

Depending on the landscape two paths are available :

  • CIS tenant Provisioning - In case no CIS tenant is available, provisioning of a CIS tenant is done from ICM and then auto-configured.
  • CIS tenant Selection - In case CIS tenants are already available, tenant selection is needed for the auto-configuration.

3.a. CIS Tenant Provisioning

Validate and submit the tenant provisioning form generated from the S-User information data.

 

3.b. CIS Tenant Selection

Select the appropriate CIS tenant for auto configuration from the list and submit.

 

Note : Landscape tier alignment is required ie: If SSO is configured on a Test SAP Ariba tenant, selection of CIS with tenant type Test is required, and similarly with Production.

4. Approval

Upon CIS tenant provisioning request (3a) or CIS tenant selection (3b) an approval is required to trigger auto-configuration.

 

  

5. Auto-Configure CIS

Auto configuration process runs upon tenant provisioning / selection showing 'Provisioning in Progress' status, it takes several minutes and generates several artefacts in CIS:

  • SAML Applications Configuration with the SAP Ariba tenant for user authentication over SSO
  • OpendID Applications Configuration with the SAP Ariba tenant for app-to-app connectivity
  • Source and Target systems in Identity Provisioning Service for user and group provisioning

Note : Auto-configuration leverages by default the Login Name attribute of the CIS user as NameID for the SAML assertion, therefore it needs to match the UniqueName attribute of the SAP Ariba user.

 

Note : The Configuration step creates several applications in the CIS tenant with dedicated pattern. In case of a Suite Integrated tenant with Multi-ERP the applications are defined as below:

Parent Realm :

  • Application for SSO on the Parent realm with normalized name <Customer name><SAP Ariba Procurement parent realm name>
  • Applications for app-to-app authentication with normalized names: Sourcing-<SAP Ariba Sourcing realm id> and Procurement-<SAP Ariba Procurement parent realm id>

Child Realm :

  • Application for SSO on the Child realm with normalized name <Customer name><SAP Ariba Procurement child realm name>
  • Application for app-to-app authentication with normalized name  : Procurement-<SAP Ariba Procurement child realm id>

 

6. Activate Configuration

Once auto-configured the system is in 'Ready to Activate' state, click the Activate button to enable SSO.

Confirm configuration acknowledgements.

 Note: Once Activated, SSO configuration cannot be deactivated from ICM, in case deactivation or configuration change is required, a support ticket needs to be raised.

Note: In case any of the SSO setup steps from S-User validation (Validate or Enable), from Approval (Approve) or from Auto-Configuration activation (Activate) takes more than 3 hours, an incident needs to be created against the BNS-ARI-RSK-ICM component.

 

7. Test Configuration

Once activated, the SSO configuration is enabled and can be validated:

7.a ICM

ICM configuration should show Activated CIS as well as Enabled SAML Authentication.

 

7.b SAP Ariba web interface access

Access SAP Ariba tenant via its URL in a web browser - for example for US Datacenter: https://<SAP Ariba tenant id>.procurement.ariba.com

Redirection to the configured CIS tenant login page validates correct setup.

 

Redirection to the SAP Ariba login page denotes an issue with SSO configuration.

 

Note : In case of  SAP Ariba Multi-ERP configuration setup, test both the Parent and Children accesses.

Remarks

Note: In case Third-Party SAP Ariba users need to be authenticated by the Identity Provider setup for SAP Ariba SSO, PLAF-1869 Feature Toggle needs to be enabled via a support ticket. Ensure you have the proper Third-Party SAP Ariba users setup in your Identity Provider setup for SAP Ariba SSO as your existing SAP Ariba credentials for Third-Party SAP Ariba users will not be working after the Feature Toggle is enabled. In case of issues accessing SAP Ariba for Third-Party SAP Ariba users via Identity Provider setup for SAP Ariba SSO ask to disable PLAF-1869 Feature Toggle to revert back to the SAP Ariba authentication of Third-Party SAP Ariba users.

Note: In case SSO was configured on the SAP Ariba tenant with CIS prior to the CFG-324 feature release, it is currently not possible to leverage this process, this blog will be update when more information will be available.

 

See as well:
  • Summary: SAP Ariba, SAP Business Network, SAP Fieldglass SSO with SAP IAS
  • Overview: SAP Ariba SSO with SAP Cloud Identity Services - Identity Authentication

entry.title: Joule in SAP Ariba Applications
entry.content:
Joule is the SAP AI copilot - a virtual assistant that uses a conversational interface to help users of SAP business applications complete tasks more efficiently.

The conversational interface is brought to life with the help of these 4 interaction patterns:

  • With informational interactions we are providing our users knowledge-based results. All SAP applications in which Joule is available make their knowledge-base available via Joule, e.g. SAP Help Documentation. This is managed by SAP and offered to every Joule user out of the box.
    We‘re also bringing in Document Grounding with which we enable our customers to upload their customer-owned content, e.g. HR-policies, travel-policies, FAQs, and others, so that their users can ask questions based on these documents.

 

  • Navigational Pattern - Easily navigate SAP applications by simply asking via natural language. Joule offers you a navigational link which opens the respective application and UI in a new browser tab. In the destination, a user can open Joule again and continue where they have left with the same conversation history.

 

  • Transactional interactions provide our users with a direct entry point to the backend system. Triggering and influencing business processes with the power of natural language and AI. E.g. purchase orders which need to be reviewed and approved, job positions which are created or any other CRUD-interaction (create, read, update, delete) within SAP cloud applications.

 

  • And a 4th, Analytical pattern to enable analytical interactions based on JustAsk and SAP Analytics Cloud, enabling customers to leverage Joule for analytical queries. This is currently not implemented in Ariba.

With the Q3 2025 release, Joule is being made available in the SAP Ariba applications of Guided Buying, Guided Sourcing and Supplier Management.

Please note that AI copilot Joule in the aforementioned products will be in Early Access until September 19th, 2025 at which time it will be made generally available to customers.

Below is the complete list of Transactional and Navigational Joule skills which are available per application area.

1. Guided Buying

Available Transactional Joule Skills

  • Get Status of Purchase Requisition – Displays the status of a specific PR
  • Show recent purchase requisitions – Displays a list of the last 10 PRs
  • Show Approvers of PR
  • Show Shipping Details
  • Show PR Details – Displays line item information of a specified PR

Available Navigational Joule Skills

  • View Requisition

2. Guided Sourcing

Available Transactional Joule Skills

  • List Sourcing Events - Displays the list of sourcing events created within a specified number of past days.
  • Return RFx status of a sourcing event – Displays the status of a specific event ID
  • Return approval status of a sourcing event – Displays the status of an approval task for the specified event
  • Send reminder email to Suppliers
  • Retrieve Supplier Invitation Details
  • Retrieve Event Timing or Event Rules
  • Display pending approvals
  • Approval Processing
  • Sourcing Approval Status Check
  • Retrieve Supplier Bids
  • Retrieve Supplier Bid Details

Available Navigational Joule Skills

  • Go to My Tasks
  • Go to For You page
  • Go to Sourcing Event
  • Go to Request Creation page

3. Supplier Management

Available Transactional Joule Skills

  • Show Primary Contact Information of Supplier – Displays contact details of Supplier
  • List Suppliers ‘In Registration’ status - Displays a list of suppliers that have started the registration process but haven't submitted questionnaires for a specific number of days.
  • List Suppliers ‘Invited’ status – Displays a list of the Suppliers that have been invited to register but haven’t responded to the invitation for a specific number of days

Available Navigational Joule Skills

  • Navigate to get Suppliers in Registration status
  • Navigate to get Suppliers in Invited status

Additionally, the Informational pattern is also available for the 3 applications which means Joule can assist users with your product-related questions by finding answers in the product documentation published on the SAP Help Portal. Along with an excerpt, it provides direct links to the relevant source documents, allowing you to explore the details further.

 

COSTING 

All the above mentioned Joule skills are part of Joule base, which means you will not be charged any AI units for these. 

You should have enabled either of the below Joule SKUs from SAP store

  • Joule Base SKU: 8019544
  • Joule Premium SKU (includes AI Units): 8019164

 

MULTI-LANGUAGE SUPPORT 

Joule will be able to understand and respond to queries in the following languages - English, German, French, Spanish, Portuguese, Japanese, Korean, Chinese, Vietnamese, Greek, Polish.

 

PREREQUISITES

Joule leverages the SAP Business Technology Platform to simplify complex integration landscapes. So the very first prerequisite is a BTP account.

1. SAP Ariba applications license : You have a license for one or more of the aforementioned SAP Ariba applications in one of the supported data centers supported by Joule, as Joule is an embedded application that is integrated with SAP products. The currently supported data centers are listed here.

2. SAP BTP : Joule leverages the SAP Business Technology Platform to simplify complex integration landscapes, which makes it the next prerequisite. You should have an enterprise global account on SAP BTP. If you already have a global account in SAP BTP, Joule entitlements can be added in the same global account.

To activate or setup Joule, you need to have the following BTP services.

3. SAP Cloud Identity Services : SAP Cloud Identity Services are a group of services of SAP BTP which enable you to handle provision and integrate identity and access management between systems, providing you a seamless SSO experience across systems with the security. SAP Cloud Identity Services are bundled with an SAP cloud solution, which means you are entitled to one productive and one test tenant preconfigured with the SAP cloud solution (Refer this link). You should have integrated the SAP Ariba application with Identity Authentication as Joule leverages the IAS setup of the SAP product for user login.

4. SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition : To support navigation to different applications from Joule and handle role based access scenarios, you need to configure the navigation service of SAP Build Work Zone. Joule uses the navigation service component of SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition to resolve intent based navigation targets and configure additional content providers.

5. You have created a subaccount in your global account using the SAP BTP cockpit for provisioning Joule. A single Joule subscription can be integrated into multiple SAP products like SAP SuccessFactors, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, or SAP Build Work Zone. However, one subscription of the Joule application can only be integrated with one tenant of an SAP product. This means you cannot include multiple systems of the same product in one Joule formation. You must ensure that there is one IAS tenant per single independent entity and operate every single independent entity from its own dedicated SAP BTP sub-account.

 

LIMITATIONS AS OF Q3 2025 RELEASE

 Buyer Parent-Child MERP (Multi-ERP) realm setup issue in Guided Buying : Joule does not currently support multi-tenant consolidation. To overcome this limitation Customers must run Joule Booster in every child realm. This also means there will be no data consolidation across the realms

entry.title: SAP Ariba 2508 Release Key Innovations Preview
entry.content:
Highlights of Enhancements across Procurement

Joule, Your AI Copilot

As you may know, Joule is the SAP AI copilot - a virtual assistant that uses a conversational interface to help users of SAP business applications complete tasks more efficiently.

The conversational interface is brought to life with the help of these 4 interaction patterns:

  • With informational interactions we are providing our users knowledge-based results. All SAP applications in which Joule is available make their knowledge-base available via Joule, e.g. SAP Help Documentation. This is managed by SAP and offered to every Joule user out of the box.
    We're also bringing in Document Grounding with which we enable our customers to upload their customer-owned content, e.g. HR-policies, travel-policies, FAQs, and others, so that their users can ask questions based on these documents.
  • Navigational Pattern - Easily navigate SAP applications by simply asking via natural language. Joule offers you a navigational link which opens the respective application and UI in a new browser tab. In the destination, a user can open Joule again and continue where they have left with the same conversation history.
  • Transactional interactions provide our users with a direct entry point to the backend system. Triggering and influencing business processes with the power of natural language and AI. E.g. purchase orders which need to be reviewed and approved, job positions which are created or any other CRUD-interaction (create, read, update, delete) within SAP cloud applications.
  • And a 4th, Analytical pattern to enable analytical interactions based on JustAsk and SAP Analytics Cloud, enabling customers to leverage Joule for analytical queries. This is currently not implemented in Ariba.

With the Q3 2025 release, Joule is being made available in the SAP Ariba applications of Guided Buying, Guided Sourcing and Supplier Management.

Please note that AI copilot Joule in the aforementioned products will be in Early Access until September 19th, 2025 at which time it will be made generally available to customers.

For a complete list of Transactional and Navigational Joule skills which are available per application area, view our new blog: Joule 2508 Release Key Innovations

 

SAP Ariba Category Management Highlights

Ability to Set an Initiative as Obsolete in SAP Ariba Category Management (ARBCATA-463)

Keeping your workspace organized is essential for focus and efficiency. With this feature you can now manually mark outdated initiatives as obsolete, easily closing those that are no longer relevant. This means your team will see only initiatives that matter, reducing clutter and helping everyone prioritize more effectively.

Additionally, the Initiatives Overview page now allows you to filter by multiple phases—including the Obsolete phase—so you can quickly get the view you need and keep data clean and actionable.

 

Standardized and Detailed Category Risk Assessment (ARBCATA-489)

Risk management is fundamental to strong category strategies. With this feature , the risk assessment tool has been enhanced so administrators can define standardized risk types for evaluation across all purchasing categories.

The new Risk Types page on the Strategy and Plan tab

Category managers can now identify, score, and qualify each risk in detail, with information like cause, impact, and mitigation strategies.

The New Risk page that appears when you click Create on the Risk Assessment page now includes 3 sections: Assessment, Details, and Mitigation. These scores contribute to an overall risk score at the strategy and plan level, which reflects the combined risk across category, timeframe, business unit, and region. This gives category managers a structured, repeatable approach to assessing category supporting informed decision-making at every level.

The Risk Assessment page now displays a Risk Assessment Matrix and Risks table.

 

Ability to Select Tool Documents for AI-generated Category Strategy Recommendations (CATMAN-16)

Now that it’s possible (with the above feature) to create multiple Cost Structure and Market Dynamics documents, this new AI-driven strategy recommendations allows you to choose which Cost Structure and Market Dynamics documents to include, ensuring the insights you receive are tailored to your specific business needs. This accelerates the development of effective strategies, minimizing revisions and aligning recommendations with your goals.

You can now choose specific Cost Structure and Market Dynamics documents when generating recommendations for category strategy details, in cases where multiple tool documents are linked to a strategy and plan document

For further details on these innovations and more, view our new blog:  Category Management 2508 Release Key Innovations

 

Highlights from Source-to-Contract

SAP Ariba Contracts Integration with WalkMe (SCONTR-1444)

This feature facilitates the integration between SAP Ariba Contracts and the WalkMe Digital Adoption Platform. Through this integration, buyers receive on-demand guidance from WalkMe for several commonly used workflows within SAP Ariba Contracts.

This enables organizations to accelerate user adoption of technology, boost productivity, and maximize the value of enterprise software investments.

Smart walk-throughs powered by WalkMe are available for the following workflows within SAP Ariba Contracts:
  • Creating a contract workspace
  • Importing line items into a contract workspace using the Simplified Excel Import functionality
  • Creating contract workspace templates

 

Managing Baseline and Supplier Contracts for Pre-Award Negotiation in Icertis Contract Intelligence for SAP Ariba Solutions (SCONTR-1499)

If your organization uses Icertis Contract Intelligence (ICI) alongside SAP Ariba, you can now manage both baseline and supplier contracts directly in Icertis during pre-award negotiations.

We've also improved the APIs so that developers can easily copy data from one contract workspace to another.

 

Display Remaining Time for Line Items in Bid Console for Guided Sourcing Auctions and Competitive RFPs (SOURCE-2544)

This feature enables buyers to view the remaining time for line items and lots within the Bid Console page and is applicable to guided sourcing events such as English forward auctions, English reverse auctions, and competitive RFPs.

Timing matters! The bid console now clearly shows how much time is left per line item (or lot) during auctions and RFPs.

 

The changes are applicable for competitive RFP, Auction, Reverse auction bid console screens. For Japanese, dutch auctions the new column Time remaining will not show and the watch screen timer values will not change.

 

For further details on these innovations and more, view our blog: Source-to-Contract 2508 Release Key Innovations

 

Highlights from Procure-to-Order

AI Copilot Joule in Guided Buying (GUIDEB-1163) - GA September 19th 

AI copilot Joule in Guided Buying features a conversational interface designed to help users complete tasks efficiently. It leverages generative and other AI technologies to understand natural language requests, identify user intent, perform actions, and provide valuable insights.

With Joule, you can easily access information such as:

  • Requisition approval status
  • Requisition details
  • Recent purchases

You can find the Joule panel by clicking on the icon at the top of your screen. This release is just the beginning of our journey to harness AI across buying processes, driving significant efficiency gains and more for our entire user base.

Please note that AI copilot Joule in Guided Buying will be in Early Access until September 19th, 2025 at which time it will be made generally available to customers

For more detailed information please see this blog: Joule in SAP Ariba Applications

 

Enhancements to WalkMe in Guided Buying (GUIDEB-1266) 

We were excited to announce the first iteration of WalkMe in Guided Buying in the last release (2505), now to build on this momentum with an important user experience enhancement.

The WalkMe Digital Adoption Platform is now enabled for all Guided Buying customers and the WalkMe panel can now display content from SAP Companion also through some subtle UI changes.

If both WalkMe and SAP Companion are enabled, the walk me panel now displays a separate tab for each respectively:

 

Previously, WalkMe was disabled by default, and SAP Companion content displayed in a different panel.

This innovation offers more flexibility, allowing you to use the right resources and support at the right time in the most suitable way. It will help guide you seamlessly through your desired procurement processes and drive better outcomes.

For further details on these innovations and more, view our blog: Procure-to-Order 2508 Release Key Innovations

 

Highlights from Central Invoice Management

Enriched Filtering Capabilities for the Invoice List (CIM-2270) 

We know that dealing with large volumes of invoices can be challenging, especially when you need to find that one specific invoice or group relevant data for reporting and analysis. With our latest release, we’re streamlining this process even further.

Within the invoice list you can use the Adapt Filters button to add several new filters to the filter bar. For additional information on how to adapt filters in the invoice list, see Adapting Filters and Creating Variants. The following filters are now available:

  • Company Code Country/Region
  • Supplier Country/Region
  • Purchase Order

The new filters allow you to search the invoice list more precisely and accurately as seen in the image below:

 

Posting Date Automatically Updated During Automatic Processing (CIM-2920)

For organizations that use automatic processing for invoices in SAP Ariba, you likely set a default posting date—often the current date—when invoices are automatically submitted. With our new enhancement, if you have defined the default posting date as the current date, the system now dynamically updates the posting date to the exact current date right before the invoice is submitted.

We understand that sometimes, there may be a delay between when automatic processing starts and when an invoice is actually submitted. In the past, this gap meant an invoice could end up with a posting date that was out of alignment with the real submission time, potentially causing confusion or even issues with financial reporting or compliance.

With the new enhancement, the posting date will always reflect the true date of submission—even if the process experiences minor delays. This change can have a major impact for finance and accounting teams.

 

Submission of Invoices Enriched by Data Attribute Recommendation (CIM-2965)

With this feature, changes have been made to the automatic submission process for invoices enriched by data attribute recommendation. Now, when the confidence threshold for fields enriched by data attribute recommendation is between 0.5 and 0.7, the automatic submission is stopped, and you can review the fields within the invoice on the invoice detail page. You can then manually submit the invoice or adjust the invoice before submitting.

Data attribute recommendation can automatically enrich and complete the following fields in draft invoices:

  • G/L Account
  • Cost Center
  • WBS Element

Data attribute recommendation is a machine learning service that is trained with a set of invoices that you select. Once data attribute recommendation is trained and activated, SAP Ariba CIM can automatically complete missing fields in draft invoices using the data learned during the training.

For further details on these innovations and more, view our blog: Central Invoice Management 2508 Release Key Innovations

 

Highlights from Supplier Management & Risk

Supplier Management Integration with WalkMe (SLP-2265)
This feature integrates SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance and SAP Ariba Supplier Information and Performance Management (new architecture) with WalkMe Digital Adoption Platform. Users can take advantage of easy-to-understand guidance powered by WalkMe.

Supplier Management WalkMe integration includes several standard smart walk-throughs from SAP Ariba for common workflows. Customers can also choose to develop their own content by first purchasing WalkMe Premium for SAP Ariba solutions. For more information about WalkMe Premium for SAP Ariba solutions, see https://walkme.com

If you have an SAP Companion help system enabled, its help content remains available.

View implementation details and more here.

 

AI Copilot Joule in Supplier Management (SLP-2258)
Joule, SAP's generative AI copilot, is now available in supplier management. Joule uses a conversational interface to help users complete tasks efficiently. It leverages generative and other AI technologies to understand natural language requests, identify intent, perform actions, and provide insights. Using generative AI, it can execute tasks, deliver tailored responses, and summarize information effectively.

(IMPORTANT: AI Copilot Joule in SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance will be in early access until September 19th, 2025, at which time it will be made generally available to customers.)

View implementation details and more here.

For the list of tasks that you can perform using Joule, refer to the topic Joule Capabilities in Supplier Management.

 

Option to Join the SAP User Research Panel (SRISK-1771)
This feature provides you an option to join the SAP User Research Panel, where you can share your thoughts and ideas to enhance SAP Ariba Supplier Risk and other SAP products you currently use.

View implementation details and more here.

 

Risk Exposure Summary Report Displays Overall Residual and Inherent Risk Levels (SRISK-1763)

This feature provides information about the inherent and residual risk levels of suppliers in the Risk Exposure Summary report. This crucial information aids in making informed decisions when engaging with suppliers.

In addition to the existing risk exposure information, the Risk Exposure Summary report now includes two additional columns to provide inherent and residual risk level information for the suppliers you monitor in SAP Ariba Supplier Risk.

Changes to the User Interface - Currently, the Risk Exposure Summary report summarizes the overall risk exposure, and category-wise risk exposure such as legal and regulatory, environmental and social, and operational risk exposure. This enhancement introduces two additional columns to display overall inherent risk level and residual risk level information for the suppliers you monitor in SAP Ariba Supplier Risk.

View implementation details and more here.

For further details on these innovations and more, view our blog: Supplier Management & Risk 2508 Release Key Innovations 

 

These innovations aim to significantly enhance your procurement and sourcing capabilities, leading to improved efficiency, data-driven insights, and strengthened supplier relationships.
